news.description: India’s semiconductor market is set to nearly double to $103bn by 2030, driven by AI, electric mobility and defence modernisation. Data centre capacity will jump from 1.5 GW to 9 GW, while the IndiaAI Mission exceeds GPU targets. Despite growth, the ecosystem…

news.title: U.S. defense and tech sectors face crippling shortages of key minerals controlled by China
news.description: China’s rare earth export controls are crippling U.S. aerospace and semiconductor production. The price of critical yttrium has soared 69-fold in a year, halting some production lines. U.S. chipmakers face dangerous shortages of scandium, threatening 5G techn…

news.description: Hours before Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei's interview, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth deemed the AI company a "supply chain risk to national security," which restricts military contractors from doing business with Anthropic.

news.title: Nvidia set to launch new chip that could reset the AI race, says report — Key things to know
news.description: Nvidia is in the process of designing a new system for “inference” computing. This will allow the company's customers and their AI models to respond to queries, as per WSJ. This will make the work of companies like OpenAI easier.

news.title: Bitcoin slides to $65,000 in weekend sell-off, with solana, XRP, dogecoin down 6%
news.description: The pullback erased most of Wednesday's push toward $70,000 as hot producer-price data and a post-earnings Nvidia decline dragged risk assets lower heading into the weekend.

news.title: Nvidia plans new chip to speed AI processing: WSJ
news.description: Nvidia plans to launch a new processor to help OpenAI and other clients run AI systems faster and more efficiently. The chip is for “inference” computing and will debut at Nvidia’s GTC conference. It incorporates a design by startup Groq.

news.title: OpenAI gets $110 billion in funding from a trio of tech powerhouses, led by Amazon
news.description: OpenAI secures $110 billion in funding from Amazon, Nvidia, and SoftBank, enhancing its AI capabilities and global reach.

news.description: Anthropic says it would be “legally unsound” for the Pentagon to blacklist its technology after talks over military use of its artificial intelligence models broke down.

news.title: Pentagon casts cloud of doubt over Anthropic’s AI business
news.description: Anthropic PBC, one of the fastest-growing AI startups, faces a major setback after the Trump administration ordered federal agencies to stop using its software and the Pentagon labelled it a supply-chain risk.

news.description: US President Donald Trump has ordered all government agencies to immediately stop using Anthropic AI after the company’s CEO, Dario Amodei, refused to accede to the Pentagon’s demands to use its tech for mass surveillance

news.title: Anthropic faces 6-month federal phaseout after Trump orders agencies to halt its AI use
news.description: Trump ordered federal agencies to halt use of Anthropic after the Pentagon labelled the AI firm a supply-chain risk amid a dispute over military guardrails.

news.description: This came hours after Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth issued the order in a statement on X following a directive from President Donald Trump who asked every federal agency to drop Anthropic and Claude from its workflow.

news.title: Anthropic says it will challenge Pentagon's supply chain risk designation in court
news.description: Anthropic ​said on ​Friday it will challenge ‌in ⁠court the ⁠Pentagon's ​decision to ​declare the AI firm ​a ⁠supply-chain risk, ‌hours ​after ​U.S. ⁠President Donald Trump also ​directed every ​federal agency to stop ‌work with ​the company.

news.title: Anthropic says it will challenge Pentagon's supply chain risk designation in court
news.description: Feb 27 : Anthropic said on Friday it will challenge in court the Pentagon's decision to declare the AI firm a supply-chain risk, hours after U.S. President Donald Trump also directed every federal agency to stop work with the company.

news.title: Linux-based Orange Pi Neo gaming handheld delayed due to rising RAM and storage costs
news.description: The Orange Pi Neo gaming handheld has been delayed, blaming supply chain issues. The gaming handheld was first announced back in 2024, boasting a 7-inch FHD+ 120 Hz display, AMD Zen 4 APUs, and up to 2 TB storage.

stocks.ai_explanation: TSMC is a major semiconductor manufacturer known for its advanced manufacturing processes. This is an educational summary, not financial advice.
AMD is a prominent player in the graphics card and CPU markets. This is an educational summary, not financial advice.
ASML is a Dutch equipment supplier specializing in lithography machines used in semiconductor manufacturing. This is an educational summary, not financial advice.
Intel Corporation is a leader in computer hardware and software development. This is an educational summary, not financial advice.
Qualcomm Inc., a mobile communications technology company. This is an educational summary, not financial advice.
